DOC.brief_summary: Epidemiological study show obesity risk factor asthma . Research evidence obesity atopic ( ie . allergic ) -related respiratory disease , less clear . The purpose present study test hypothesis relationship obesity atopic-related respiratory disease premenopausal woman mediate dietary imbalance omega 6 3 polyunsaturated fatty acid .
DOC.brief_title: Dietary Arachidonic Acid , Obesity Atopic Respiratory Disease
DOC.detailed_description: Sixty young adult obese non obese woman , , without asthma , study use cross-sectional design . Body composition measure plethysmography . A fasted blood sample take measure : specific total immunoglobulin ( IgE ) antibody , biochemical marker atopy ; glucose insulin measure insulin sensitivity ; estrogen ( 17β-estradiol ) sex hormone-binding globulin measure estrogen status woman ; hormone-products fat tissue ( leptin , adiponectin , resistin , tumor necrosis factor alpha ( TNFα ) , interleukin ( IL-6 , IL-18 ) , associate obesity immune process involve asthma allergy . Dietary intake omega 6 : linoleic acid ( LA ) , arachidonic acid ( AA ) ; omega 3 fatty acid : α linolenic ( ALA ) , eicosapentanoic ( EPA ) docosahexanoic ( DHA ) nutrient assess food frequency questionnaire .
DOC.criteria: For asthmatic , individual willing capable use asthma medication two day prior laboratory test . An individual exclude study history high blood pressure , diabetes , heart disease , cigarette smoking , eat disorder . Women pregnant lactating .
